title: Church of the Holy Apostles at Constantinople
description: Construction of a church dedicated to the Twelve Apostles at Constantinople began in 330 CE under Constantine the Great, and was completed during the reign of his son Constantius II (331-367). A larger church was established on the same site in 550 by Justinian I. The church was demolished by Mehmed II in 1462, and the Fatih Mosque was constructed on its site.

properties.description: Point representing the visible location of Fatih Mosque, constructed on the site of the Church of the Holy Apostles following its destruction in 1462.
properties.title: Google Earth location of the Church of the Holy Apostles
